intro: Pseudoeurystyles lorenzii, commonly known as the Lophopetalum lorenzii, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central America, particularly in Mexico. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and requires partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
